channel.description: Recent content in Blog on Zangwei

item.title: May 2023 | Can We Use LLM to Speedup LLM Inference?
item.author: zhengzangw@gmail.com (Zangwei (Alex) Zheng)
item.description: May 2023 | Can we use LLM to Speedup LLM inference? Zangwei Zheng, zangwei@u.nus.edu National University of Singapore Other version: [arXiv] [Code] [中文] Discuss on twitter with the author. TL;DR We find that large language models (LLMs) have the remarkable ability to perceive the length of their generated responses in advance. Leveraging this LLM ability, we propose a novel technique called Sequence Scheduling to improve the efficiency of LLM batch inference.

item.title: Jul. 2023 | Fine-tuning Vision-Language Models without Zero-Shot Transfer Degradation
item.author: zhengzangw@gmail.com (Zangwei (Alex) Zheng)
item.description: Jul. 2023 | Fine-tuning Vision-Language Models without Zero-Shot Transfer Degradation Zangwei Zheng, zangwei@u.nus.edu National University of Singapore Other version: [arXiv] [Code] [中文] Discuss on twitter with the author. TL;DR Large vision-language models have the ability to make predictions on various tasks without the need for fine-tuning. However, continuously fine-tuning these models can lead to improved performance on new data or tasks. Nevertheless, we have observed a significant decline in zero-shot performance on other datasets when models undergo continual learning.
